lspy.aidfunc package¶

Submodules¶

lspy.aidfunc.add_to_data_func module¶

lspy.aidfunc.add_to_data_func.add_to_data_func(data, *args)¶

A function to add values to a list with a timestamp.

The data will be kept into a tuple and added to the list. Note that a timestamp is always added as the first item in the tuple. This timestamp, however has no fixed epoch. So only differences in time have a real meaning.

Parameters

  • data (list) – The list one wishes to append the data to.

  • *args – The data one wishes to append to data.

lspy.aidfunc.convert_data module¶

lspy.aidfunc.convert_data.convert_data(data)¶

Converts a list made with add_to_data_func into seperate lists.

Parameters

data (list of tuple) – A list created with add_to_data_func

Returns

All the data in seperate lists. The first list will always be the time passed.

Return type

tuple of numpy.ndarray

lspy.aidfunc.error_func module¶

This module contains all package specific Exceptions of lspy.

The module also contains functions to raise Exceptions.

exception lspy.aidfunc.error_func.NoNextNeighbourhood¶

Bases: Exception

Is raised when there is no next neighbourhood.

exception lspy.aidfunc.error_func.WrongMoveTypeError¶

Bases: Exception

Is raised when the wrong move type is used with a certain class.

lspy.aidfunc.error_func.not_multi_move_type(*args)¶

An error raising function that can take any amount of parameters.

This function is meant to be called when someone uses a different move type than MultiNeighbourhood when one needs to use an instance of the MultiNeighbourhood class.

Parameters

*args – Variable length argument list, it does not matter what or how many parameters you use. Does not accept keyword arguments.

Raises

WrongMoveType – This error will always be raised.

lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func module¶

This module contains functions to check if a value is an improvement.

lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func.bigger(old_value, value)¶

Checks if a value is an improvement. Bigger values are improvements.

Parameters

  • old_value (int or float) – The old value.

  • value (int or float) – The new value that is checked.

Returns

Returns true if the new value is bigger than the old value, else returns false.

Return type

bool

Examples

Some simple tests:

>>> from lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func import bigger
>>> bigger(2, 5)
True
>>> bigger(5, 2)
False
>>> bigger(3,3)
False
lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func.bigger_or_equal(old_value, value)¶

Checks if a value is an improvement. Bigger values are improvements.

Parameters

  • old_value (int or float) – The old value.

  • value (int or float) – The new value that is checked.

Returns

Returns true if the new value is bigger or equal to the old value, else returns false.

Return type

bool

Examples

Some simple tests:

>>> from lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func import bigger_or_equal
>>> bigger_or_equal(2, 5)
True
>>> bigger_or_equal(5, 2)
False
>>> bigger_or_equal(3,3)
True
lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func.smaller(old_value, value)¶

Checks if a value is an improvement. Smaller values are improvements.

Parameters

  • old_value (int or float) – The old value.

  • value (int or float) – The new value that is checked.

Returns

Returns true if the new value is smaller than the old value, else returns false.

Return type

bool

Examples

Some simple tests:

>>> from lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func import smaller
>>> smaller(2, 5)
False
>>> smaller(5, 2)
True
>>> smaller(3,3)
False
lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func.smaller_or_equal(old_value, value)¶

Checks if a value is an improvement. Smaller values are improvements.

Parameters

  • old_value (int or float) – The old value.

  • value (int or float) – The new value that is checked.

Returns

Returns true if the new value is smaller or equal to the old value, else returns false.

Return type

bool

Examples

Some simple tests:

>>> from lspy.aidfunc.is_improvement_func import smaller_or_equal
>>> smaller_or_equal(2, 5)
False
>>> smaller_or_equal(5, 2)
True
>>> smaller_or_equal(3,3)
True

lspy.aidfunc.logging module¶

lspy.aidfunc.logging.log_improvement(value)¶

function to log improvements to the command line.

Parameters

value (int or float) – The value for the improvement

lspy.aidfunc.logging.log_passed_worse(value)¶

function to log the passing of worse solutions to the command line.

Parameters

value (int or float) – The value for the improvement

lspy.aidfunc.pass_func module¶

lspy.aidfunc.pass_func.pass_func(*args)¶

A function that does nothing.

Parameters

args – Variable length argument list, it does not matter what or how many parameters you use. Does not accept keyword arguments.

Module contents¶

This package contains multiple aid functions.

The functions should only be used by other functions and methods in lspy.

lspy
